result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaquille McNeal Winston

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shaquille McNeal Winston appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Shaquille McNeal Winston.  Attorney Catelin Ringersma appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant agrees to proceed with hearing via zoom. Amended Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 and 3.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shaquille McNeal Winston appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Shaquille McNeal Winston.  Attorney Catelin Ringersma appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Shaquille McNeal Winston not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for arraignment. Defendant not produced for hearing via zoom. Court contacted Stanley Correctional and was advised defendant was moved and unable to appear. Court reschedules case in Branch 4.  Arraignment scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Shaquille McNeal Winston not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for arraignment, however defendant was not produced for hearing from prison. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Arraignment scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Shaquille McNeal Winston in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Shaquille McNeal Winston in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 12CF4261 & 18CF2486. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Detective  B. Isaacson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shaquille McNeal Winston in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Shaquille McNeal Winston in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shaquille McNeal Winston appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
